article.title: BeOS

template.arg: [[Monolithic kernel]]http://www.osdata.com/oses/beos.htm“BeOS’ kernel is ‘prioprietary’. It uses its own kernel (small but not really micro-kernel because it includes the file system and a few other things).” —Hubert Figuière

article.paragraph: BeOSis anoperating systemforpersonal computersfirst developed byBe Inc.in 1991. It was first written to run onBeBoxhardware. BeOS was built for digital media work and was written to take advantage of modern hardware facilities such assymmetric multiprocessingby utilizing modular I/O bandwidth, pervasive multithreading,preemptive multitaskingand a64-bitjournaling file systemknown asBe File SystemBFS. The BeOS GUI was developed on the principles of clarity and a clean, uncluttered design.

BeOS was positioned as a multimedia platform which could be used by a substantial population of desktop users and a competitor toMac OSandMicrosoft Windows. However, it was ultimately unable to achieve a significant market share and proved commercially unviable for Be Inc. The company was acquired byPalm Inc.and today BeOS is mainly used and developed by a small population of enthusiasts.

The open-source OSHaiku (operating system)Haiku, a complete reimplementation of BeOS, is designed to start up where BeOS left off. Alpha 4 of Haiku was released in November 2012.Citationhttp://www.haiku-os.org/news/2012-11-12_haiku_release_1_alpha_4Haiku Release 1 Alpha 4November 12, 2012Haiku-OS.orghttp://web.archive.org/web/20131222225116/https://www.haiku-os.org/news/2012-11-12_haiku_release_1_alpha_42013-12-22
article.heading: Design
article.paragraph: BeOS was optimized for digital media work and was written to take advantage of moderncomputer hardwarefacilities such assymmetric multiprocessingby utilizing modular I/O bandwidth, pervasive multithreading,preemptive multitaskingand a64-bitjournaling file systemknown asBe File SystemBFS. The BeOS GUI was developed on the principles of clarity and a clean, uncluttered design.

Theapplication programming interfaceAPIwas written inC++for ease of programming. It has partialPOSIXcompatibility and access to acommand-line interfacethroughBash (Unix shell)Bash, although internally it is not aUnix-derived operating system.
BeOS usedUnicodeas the default encoding in the GUI, though support for input methods such asbidirectional textinput was never realized.
article.heading: History
article.paragraph: Initially designed to run onAT&T Hobbit-based hardware, BeOS was later modified to run onPowerPC-based processors: first Be's own systems, laterApple Inc.'sPowerPC Reference PlatformandCommon Hardware Reference Platform, with the hope that Apple would purchase or license BeOS as a replacement for its agingMac OS#"Classic" Mac OS (19842001)Mac OS.cite webhttp://macreate.net/reloaded/?qBeOS @ MaCreate2004-11-24Tom2006-11-16http://web.archive.org/web/20050324220739/http://macreate.net/reloaded/?q2005-03-24Apple CEOGil Ameliostarted negotiations to buy Be Inc., but negotiations stalled when Be CEOJean-Louis Gassewanted $300 million;cite webTomHormbyThe Rise and Fall of Apple’s Gil Ameliohttp://lowendmac.com/2013/the-rise-and-fall-of-apples-gil-amelio/Low End MacCobweb Publishing, Inc.28 March 2015Apple was unwilling to offer any more than $125 million. Apple's board of directors decidedNeXTSTEPwas a better choice and purchasedNeXTin 1996 for $429 million, bringing back Apple co-founderSteve Jobs.cite webhttp://macspeedzone.com/archive/art/con/be.shtmlApple Confidential: The Day They Almost Decided To Put Windows NT On The Mac Instead Of OS X!Owen W. Linzmayer1999Mac Speed Zone18 January 2014http://web.archive.org/web/20130624175316/http://www.macspeedzone.com/archive/art/con/be.shtml2013-06-24

In 1997,Power Computingbegan bundling BeOS (on a CD for optional installation) with its line of PowerPC-basedMacintosh clones. These systems coulddual booteither theMac OSor BeOS, with a start-up screen offering the choice.cite webhttp://www.haiku-os.org/legacy-docs/benewsletter/Issue1-36.htmlBe Newsletters, Volume 1: 1995-19961996HaikuOSBe Inc.18 January 2014http://web.archive.org/web/20101217020944/http://haiku-os.org/legacy-docs/benewsletter/Issue1-36.html2010-12-17

Due to Apple's moves and the mounting debt of Be Inc., BeOS was soon ported to theX86 architectureIntel x86platform with its R3 release in March 1998.cite webhttp://www.haiku-os.org/legacy-docs/benewsletter/Issue3-24.htmlBe Newsletters, Volume 3: 19981998Haiku OSBe Inc.18 January 2014http://web.archive.org/web/20130722115320/http://www.haiku-os.org/legacy-docs/benewsletter/Issue3-24.html2013-07-22Through the late 1990s, BeOS managed to create a niche of followers, but the company failed to remain viable. Be Inc. also released a stripped-down, but free, copy ofBeOS R5known as BeOS Personal Edition (BeOS PE). BeOS PE could be started from withinMicrosoft WindowsorLinux, and was intended to nurture consumer interest in its product and give developers something to tinker with.cite webhttp://www.haiku-os.org/legacy-docs/benewsletter/Issue5-13.htmlBe Newsletters, Volume 5: 20002000Haiku OSBe Inc.18 January 2014http://web.archive.org/web/20101217034633/http://haiku-os.org/legacy-docs/benewsletter/Issue5-13.html2010-12-17cite webhttp://www.yellowbites.com/beos.htmlBeOS/ZetaYellowBitesYellowBites18 January 2014http://web.archive.org/web/20131127165851/http://yellowbites.com/beos.html2013-11-27Be Inc. also released a stripped-down version of BeOS for Internet Appliances (BeIA), which soon became the company's business focus in place of BeOS.cite webhttp://www.haiku-os.org/legacy-docs/benewsletter/Issue5-17.htmlBe Newsletters, Volume 5: 20002000Haiku OSBe Inc.18 January 2014http://web.archive.org/web/20130722101638/http://www.haiku-os.org/legacy-docs/benewsletter/Issue5-17.html2013-07-22

In 2001 Be's copyrights were sold toPalm, Inc.for some $11 million. BeOS R5 is considered the last official version, but BeOS R5.1 "Dano (BeOS)Dano", which was under development before Be's sale to Palm and included theBeOS Networking Environment(BONE) networking stack, was leaked to the public shortly after the company's demise.cite webhttps://www.haiku-os.org/legacy-docs/benewsletter/Issue5-5.htmlBe Newsletters, Volume 5 : 20002000Haiku OSBe Inc18 January 2014http://web.archive.org/web/20130722105220/http://www.haiku-os.org/legacy-docs/benewsletter/Issue5-5.html2013-07-22cite webhttp://www.osnews.com/story/552/More-Information-on-the-BeOS-Dano-VersionMore Information on the BeOS Dano VersionJake Daniels23 January 2001OSNewsOSNews18 January 2014http://web.archive.org/web/20140314090430/http://www.osnews.com/story/552/More-Information-on-the-BeOS-Dano-Version2014-03-14

In 2002, Be Inc. suedMicrosoftclaiming thatHitachihad been dissuaded from selling PCs loaded with BeOS, and thatCompaqhad been pressured not to market an Internet appliance in partnership with Be. Be also claimed that Microsoft acted to artificially depress Be Inc.'sinitial public offering(IPO).cite webhttp://www.theregister.co.uk/2002/02/20/be_inc_sues_microsoft/Be Inc. sues Microsoft2002-02-20Andrew Orlowski2008-04-24http://web.archive.org/web/20080420193929/http://www.theregister.co.uk/2002/02/20/be_inc_sues_microsoft/20 April 2008noThe case was eventually settled out of court for $23.25 million with no admission of liability on Microsoft's part.cite webhttp://www.internetnews.com/ent-news/print.php/3073811/Microsoft Settles Anti-Trust Charges with Be2003-09-08Mark Berniker2008-04-24http://web.archive.org/web/20131109045719/http://www.internetnews.com/ent-news/print.php/3073811/2013-11-09

After the split from Palm,PalmSourceused parts of BeOS's multimedia framework for its failedPalm OS#Palm OS CobaltPalm OS Cobaltproduct.PalmSource Introduces Palm OS Cobalt, PalmSource press release, 10 February 2004.Waybackhttp://www.access-company.com/news/press/PalmSource/2004/021004_cobalt.html20120721033812With the takeover of PalmSource, the BeOS rights now belong toAccess Co.ACCESS Completes Acquisition of PalmSource, ACCESS press release, November 14, 2005.Waybackhttp://www.palmsource.com/press/2005/111405_access.html20070105165010
article.heading: Continuation and clones
article.paragraph: In the years that followed the demise of Be Inc. a handful of projects formed to recreate BeOS or key elements of the OS with the eventual goal of then continuing where Be Inc. left off. This was facilitated by the fact that Be Inc. released some components of BeOS under a free licence. Here is a list of these projects:

list.listitem: BlueEyedOS: It uses a modified version of the Linux kernel which allows it to run Beos applications. It is free and open source software. There have been no releases since 2003.cite webhttp://www.blueeyedos.com/Welcome to BlueEyedOS26 June 2003BlueEyedOSBlueEyedOS18 January 2014http://web.archive.org/web/20140407132603/http://www.blueeyedos.com/2014-04-07

Cosmoe: A user interface for Linux that can run most BeOS applications. It is free and open source software. The last release was in 2004 and its website is no longer online.cite webhttp://www.cosmoe.com/http://web.archive.org/web/20110602144005/http://www.cosmoe.com/2011-06-02The Cosmoe Operating System2 June 2011Internet ArchiveCosmoe18 January 2014

E/OS: short for Emulator Operating System. A Linux andFreeBSD-based operating system that aimed to runWindows,DOS,AmigaOSand BeOS applications. It is free and open source software.cite webhttp://www.thefreecountry.com/operating-systems/beos.shtmlFree BeOS and BeOS Clones30 November 2009The Free CountryThe Free Country18 January 2014Active development ended in July 2008.

Haiku (operating system)Haiku: A complete reimplementation of BeOS not based on Linux. It is free and open source software. The first alpha release, "Haiku R1 / Alpha 1", was released on September 14, 2009.cite webhttp://www.haiku-os.org/news/2009-09-13_haiku_project_announces_availability_haiku_r1alpha_1Haiku Project Announces Availability of Haiku R1/Alpha 12009-09-14http://web.archive.org/web/20131221080301/https://www.haiku-os.org/news/2009-09-13_haiku_project_announces_availability_haiku_r1alpha_12013-12-21The second alpha release, "Haiku R1 / Alpha 2", was made available on May 9, 2010,cite webhttp://www.haiku-os.org/news/2010-05-10_haiku_project_announces_availability_haiku_r1alpha_2Haiku Project Announces Availability of Haiku R1/Alpha 22010-05-09http://web.archive.org/web/20140314090249/http://www.haiku-os.org/news/2010-05-10_haiku_project_announces_availability_haiku_r1alpha_22014-03-14and the third alpha release, "Haiku R1 / Alpha 3", on June 18, 2011.Citationhttp://www.haiku-os.org/news/2011-06-18_haiku_release_1_alpha_3Haiku Release 1 Alpha 3June 18, 2011Haiku-OS.orghttp://web.archive.org/web/20110623133528/http://www.haiku-os.org:80/news/2011-06-18_haiku_release_1_alpha_32011-06-23"Haiku R1 / Alpha 4" was released November 12, 2012.Citationhttp://www.haiku-os.org/news/2012-11-12_haiku_release_1_alpha_4Haiku Release 1 Alpha 4November 12, 2011Haiku-OS.orghttp://web.archive.org/web/20131222225116/https://www.haiku-os.org/news/2012-11-12_haiku_release_1_alpha_42013-12-22As of 2014, it is the only BeOS clone still under development.

article.paragraph: Magnussoft ZETAZetawas a commercially available operating system based on the BeOS R5.1 codebase. Originally developed byyellowTAB, the operating system was then distributed bymagnussoft. During development by yellowTAB, the company received criticism from the BeOS community for refusing to discuss its legal position with regard to the BeOS codebase (perhaps for contractual reasons).Access Co.(which boughtPalmSource, until then the holder of the intellectual property associated with BeOS) has since declared that yellowTAB had no right to distribute a modified version of BeOS, and magnussoft has ceased distribution of the operating system.cite webhttp://www.operating-system.org/betriebssystem/_english/bs-zeta.htmZeta Operating System14 October 2013Operating System.orgOperating System.org18 January 2014http://web.archive.org/web/20140314085635/http://www.operating-system.org/betriebssystem/_english/bs-zeta.htm2014-03-14
article.heading: Version history
Products using BeOS
article.paragraph: BeOS (and now Zeta) continue to be used in media appliances such as the Edirol DV-7 video editors fromRoland corporationwhich run on top of a modified BeOScite webhttp://www.edirol.com/products/dv7dl/index.htmlEDIROL by Roland DV-7DL Series Digital Video Workstations2006-11-16http://web.archive.org/web/20061110070209/http://www.edirol.com/products/dv7dl/index.html2006-11-10and the TuneTracker radio automation software that used to run it on BeOS and Zeta, and it was also sold as a "Station-in-a-Box" with the Zeta operating system included.cite webhttp://www.tunetrackersystems.com/products.htmlTuneTracker Radio Automation Software2006-12-09http://web.archive.org/web/20061114113220/http://www.tunetrackersystems.com/products.html14 November 2006noNowadays TuneTracker has switched to Haiku.

The Tascam SX-1 digital audio recorder runs a heavily modified version of BeOS that will only launch the recording interface software.cite webhttp://haikuware.com/20110906596/professional-audio-coming-to-haikuProfessional Audio Coming to Haiku?6 September 2011HaikuwareHaikuware18 January 2014

iZ Technology sells theRADAR (audio recorder)RADAR 24 and RADAR V, hard disk-based, 24-track professional audio recorders based on BeOS 5,cite webhttp://mixonline.com/mag/audio_iz_radar/iZ RADAR 242006-12-27http://web.archive.org/web/20061227175204/http://mixonline.com/mag/audio_iz_radar/27 December 2006noalthough the newer RADAR 6 is not based on BeOS.

Magicbox, a manufacturer of signage and broadcast display machines, uses BeOS to power theirAavelinproduct line.cite webhttp://digitalcontentproducer.com/digitalsign/depth/digital_signage_hardware_05012006/Technology Showcase: Digital Signage HardwareJay Ankeney2006-05-01Digital Content Producer2006-12-09http://web.archive.org/web/20120204210751/http://digitalcontentproducer.com/digitalsign/depth/digital_signage_hardware_05012006/2012-02-04

Final Scratch, a 12 vinyl timecode record-driven DJ software/hardware system, was first developed on BeOS. The "ProFS" version was sold to a few dozen DJs prior to the 1.0 release, which ran on a Linux virtual partition.cite webhttp://createdigitalmusic.com/2008/04/ni-ends-legal-dispute-over-traktor-scratch-digital-vinyls-twisty-turny-history/Ni Ends Legal Dispute Over Traktor Scratch; Digital Vinyl's Twisty, Turny HistoryPeter Kirn28 April 2008Create Digital MusicCreate Digital Music18 January 2014http://web.archive.org/web/20140314090055/http://createdigitalmusic.com/2008/04/ni-ends-legal-dispute-over-traktor-scratch-digital-vinyls-twisty-turny-history/2014-03-14
